channel.title: [Php] Creating custom tags
channel.description:
Would it be possible to create custom tags using php.
For example you could set a variable as a text file and perhaps use ereg_replace to replace every "<print>" with "echo '" and ever "</print>" with "';". I can't get it to parse the php code this way. It is only good for creating you own html tags. I want to create tags that parse php code.
Is it possible...?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 19, 2008, 06:42:22 pm[/size][hr]Hmmm 5 views and no replies. I'm asking in the wrong community.

item.title: [Php] Creating custom tags
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

Zandia, you’re a bitch. 5 replies is nothing, and is probably just you refreshing the page.

And what kind of question is “Would it be possible to create custom tags using php.” It’s fucking PHP. Are you new to breathing?

Read full topic

item.title: [Php] Creating custom tags
item.dc:creator: @Zandia Zandia
item.description:
@Zandia wrote:

Would it be possible to create custom tags using php.

For example you could set a variable as a text file and perhaps use ereg_replace to replace every “” with “echo '” and ever “” with “’;”. I can’t get it to parse the php code this way. It is only good for creating you own html tags. I want to create tags that parse php code.

Is it possible…?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: September 19, 2008, 06:42:22 pm[/size][hr]Hmmm 5 views and no replies. I’m asking in the wrong community.
